mickel.app.image.project

Class ByteStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • mickel.app.image.project.ByteStream

  • public class ByteStream
extends Object
    This class represents a linear stream of signed or unsigned byte values that can be used for encoding RGB images and other forms of raw, binary data. Methods are available for appending and reading individual bytes, 32-bit integers, RGB pixels, and ASCII characters. A ByteStream has a built-in iterator that can traverse through the sequence of bytes stored within the stream. If necessary, the iterator can be repositioned back to the beginning of the stream using the reset() method.
    Author:
    Jeff C. Mickel

      • hasNextByte

        public boolean hasNextByte()
        Returns true if a byte of data is available to be read from this ByteStream. The iterator for this ByteStream does not move.
        Returns:
        true if and only if a byte is available to be read

      • hasNextInt

        public boolean hasNextInt()
        Returns true if a 4-byte integer is available to be read from this ByteStream. The iterator for this ByteStream does not move.
        Returns:
        true if and only if a 4-byte integer is available to be read

      • hasNextPixel

        public boolean hasNextPixel()
        Returns true if a 3-byte RGB Pixel is available to be read from this ByteStream. The iterator for this ByteStream does not move.
        Returns:
        true if and only if 3-byte RGB Pixel is available to be read

      • hasNextChar

        public boolean hasNextChar()
        Returns true if 8-bit ASCII character is available to be read from this ByteStream. The iterator for this ByteStream does not move.
        Returns:
        true if and only if an 8-bit ASCII character is available to be read

      • nextByte

        public int nextByte()
        Reads the next byte of data in this ByteStream. The iterator for this ByteStream is moved forward by one byte. If there is no byte available to be read, the iterator remains unchanged and a NoSuchElementException is thrown.
        Returns:
        The next byte of data in this ByteStream
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no byte available to be read

      • nextInt

        public int nextInt()
        Reads the integer represented by the next 4 bytes of data in this ByteStream. The iterator for this ByteStream is moved forward by 4 bytes. If there is no integer available to be read, the iterator remains unchanged.
        Returns:
        The next 32-bit, signed integer of data in this ByteStream
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no 4-byte integer available to be read

      • nextPixel

        public Pixel nextPixel()
        Reads the RGB Pixel represented by the next 3 bytes of data in this ByteStream. The iterator for this ByteStream is moved forward by 3 bytes. If there is no RGB Pixel available to be read, the iterator remains unchanged.
        Returns:
        The next RGB Pixel in this ByteStream
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no 3-byte RGB Pixel available to be read

      • nextChar

        public char nextChar()
        Reads the 8-bit ASCII character represented by the next byte of data in this ByteStream. The iterator for this ByteStream is moved forward by 1 byte. If there is no integer available to be read, the iterator remains unchanged.
        Returns:
        The next character of data in this ByteStream
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no 8-bit ASCII character available to be read
